title: Add LessWrong
body:
This Pull Request aims to add the website LessWrong to Sherlock.

LessWrong is a community for people interested in rationality.

title: Update README.md
body: Remove extra line

title: Check multiple similar usernames
body:
<!--

- [x] I've checked for similar feature requests including closed ones

## Description
<!-- 
Provide a detailed description of the feature you would like Sherlock to have
-->

It's good to search similar usernames. for example when searching for `user{?}name` we should also check for: `_`, `-` and `.`
1. `username`
2. `user.name`
3. `user-name`
4. `user_name`

title: Support for Mangadex
body:
## Checklist
- [ x ] I'm requesting support for a new site
- [ x ] I've checked for similar site support requests including closed ones
- [ x ] I've checked that the site I am requesting has not been removed in the past and is not documented in [removed_sites.md](https://github.com/sherlock-project/sherlock/blob/master/removed_sites.md)
- [ x ] The site I am requesting support for is not a pornographic website
- [ x ] I'm only requesting support of **one** website (create a separate issue for each site)

## Description
I am requesting support for [Mangadex](https://mangadex.org).
They do have a well documented REST API at https://api.mangadex.org.
Please refer to this section for searching users, https://api.mangadex.org/docs.html#tag/User


URL: https://mangadex.org

If you have questions related to `pip`, `git`, or something that is not related to Sherlock, please ask them on [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/) or [r/learnpython](https://www.reddit.com/r/learnpython/)


## Question

Raidforums is almost entirely data breaches, pirated software, etc. Why not more forums like this on here? Many are larger and already very easy to find anyways (just go to haveibeenpwned.com's list of pwned websites and search "hacking forum" or whatever).

## Description
<!--
Provide a detailed description of the bug that you have found in Sherlock.
Provide the version of Sherlock you are running.
-->

WRITE DESCRIPTION HERE

I have just recently installed sherlock, and I cannot get it to run properly. I have installed the latest version, and also have Python and Pip. Here is how I went about my installation process:
1.) Installed Sherlock Zip folder on desktop
2.) Extracted all and made a new folder on desktop
3.) Installed Python 3.10.2 windows installer and have completed the install process.
4.) Typed in this command into cmd running as admin: cd C:\Users\19706\Desktop\sherlock-master
5.) Ran the command: pip3 install â€“r requirements.txt. Then get and error that says; "ERROR: Could not open requirements file: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'requirements.txt'

Please help with this. I've been trying to find videos and articles on this, but there has been 0 help as of now.

I have also tried to clone the repo, but I get this message: git' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.

title: poetry packaging
body:
Fixes #1241.

Here are the changes required to package this with Poetry. Feel free to use it or just base your own changes off of it.

title: Python Packaging using Python-Poetry
body:
## Checklist

- [x] I'm reporting a feature request
- [x] I've checked for similar feature requests including closed ones

## Description

Currently Sherlock is never properly installed to the system or packaged into a python wheel. Instead it's pushed to a virutalenv or to the system python and still called via the sherlock.py script.

By using proper packaging, Sherlock can easily be packaged to be installed and become a command to be run from the command line. [Poetry](https://python-poetry.org/docs/) is a dependency management tool for Python which can be used to build python wheels and correctly set the console_script options allowing wheels to be installed as CLI tools.

Hi @DigitallyBorn ,

Hope you are all well and happy new year !

I deeply thinking that a flutter client for searching usernames would be just awesome.

Also, it could store with hive db, previous search, favourites, settings panel to exclude some websites to scan.

Thanks for any insights or inputs on that idea.

Cheers,
Luc

title: "" is not recognized as an internal or external command
body:
Hey,
So I am trying to download sherlock on Windows 10 and already have Python 3.8 installed. I copy the instructions from the clipboard
# clone the repo
$ git clone https://github.com/sherlock-project/sherlock.git

# change the working directory to sherlock
$ cd sherlock

# install the requirements
$ python3 -m pip install -r requirements.txt
but when I press enter I just get a bunch of messages saying how either "$" or "#" isn't recognized as an internal or external command. I tried both the normal command prompt and the admin one but that doesn't do anything. I have also moved around the zip folder thinking that would change something but it didn't
Thank you in advance.

## Description
<!--
Provide the username that is causing Sherlock to return a false positive, along with any other information that might help us fix this false positive.
-->

all capfriendly profiles are marked as existing.  for example: https://www.capfriendly.com/users/thisuserdoesnotexist-aasdfgahsfdhgafshdgfasghfdghasfd

enter any value and it will display an active user.  not sure if this is an issue with the site, but the join date for accounts that cannot possibly exist is between 2015-2019 (from what i saw).

this might be an anti-scraping tactic as well, not 100% sure.

title: Tests fail/take too long to complete
body:
<!--

######################################################################
  WARNING!
  IGNORING THE FOLLOWING TEMPLATE WILL RESULT IN ISSUE CLOSED AS INCOMPLETE
######################################################################

-->


## Checklist
<!--
Put x into all boxes (like this [x]) once you have completed what they say.
Make sure complete everything in the checklist.
-->

- [x ] I'm reporting a bug in Sherlock's functionality
- [x ] The bug I'm reporting is not a false positive or a false negative
- [x ] I've verified that I'm running the latest version of Sherlock
- [x ] I've checked for similar bug reports including closed ones
- [ x] I've checked for pull requests that attempt to fix this bug

## Description
<!--
Provide a detailed description of the bug that you have found in Sherlock.
Provide the version of Sherlock you are running.
-->

I've just run tests locally and I'm getting 28 failures. Also, tests take about 262s to complete.

```
Ran 13 tests in 262.932s
from which:
FAILED (failures=28, skipped=6)


(venv) PS C:\github\sherlock> python sherlock --version 
sherlock 0.14.0
Python HTTP for Humans.:  2.26.0
Python:  3.9.7
```

Also can you document how 100% test coverage can be achieved?
I've tried with coverage and here are the results
```
(venv) PS C:\github\sherlock\sherlock> coverage report
Name                Stmts   Miss  Cover
---------------------------------------
notify.py              60     41    32%
result.py              22      5    77%
sherlock.py           264    133    50%
sites.py               56     20    64%
tests\__init__.py       0      0   100%
tests\all.py           61      0   100%
tests\base.py          71      3    96%
---------------------------------------
TOTAL                 534    202    62%
```
I guess it's due to the failing tests...
